newsitem.title: DENMARK: Sonofon to invest 500 mln Dkk in GSM in 97.
newsitem.headline: Sonofon to invest 500 mln Dkk in GSM in 97.

text.p: Danish telecoms operator Sonofon said on Wednesday that it would invest 500 million crowns in improving and expanding its existing nationwide GSM mobile telephone net in 1997.
"We want to improve quality and we still have capacity problems," Joern Lindegaard, executive in GN Store Nord, which has a 53.5 percent stake in Sonofon, said at an investors' meeting.
Earlier Sonofon was one of four successful bidders awarded Danish DCS-1800 mobile telephone licenses by Denmark's National Telecom Agency.
Lindegaard said he estimated that investment in the DCS-1800 mobile telephone network in combination with the existing GSM net could run up to four billion crowns over the next ten years.
Sonofon said investment was required on new tele-infrastructure to successfully launch a new total mobility concept for customers, making fixed-line telephony unnecessary.
Sonofon is the main competitor of former monopoly Tele Danmark in mobile telephones with over 500,000 subscribers.
Earlier Tele Danmark, which also won a new DCS licence, said it planned to invest 600 million crowns in a new mobile telephone system by the year 2000.
